title: pOH of pure water at 50 degrees

content.question: In pure water, some of the molecules ionize according to the equation <math alttext="H 2 O ionizes to produce H with a positive 1 charge plus O H with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mo>⇄</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>OH</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math>. The extent of the ionization increases with temperature. A student heats pure water and records the measured <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="50 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as 6.6. Based on this information, which of the following mathematical relationships gives the <math alttext="p O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of pure water at <math alttext="50 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="p O H equals p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p O H equals the fraction 1 over p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="p O H equals 14 minus p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p O H equals the fraction 1 times 10 to the negative 14 power, over p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="p O H equals p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
